intro: Centaurium trichanthum, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, linear leaves. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or red, arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the branches. Centaurium trichanthum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks.
